# CLI reference

# Usage

snyk [COMMAND] [SUBCOMMAND] [OPTIONS] [PACKAGE] [CONTEXT-SPECIFIC-OPTIONS]

# Description

The Snyk CLI is a build-time tool to find and fix known vulnerabilities in your projects. For a more detailed description of Snyk CLI and Snyk, see Snyk CLIopen in new window. For an introduction on how to use the Snyk CLI, see Getting started with the CLIopen in new window.

# Available CLI commands

To learn more about each Snyk CLI command, use the --help option, for example, snyk auth --help or snyk container --help. Each command in this list is linked to the corresponding help page in these docs.

Note: Lists of all the options for Snyk CLI commands are on this page. The options are explained in detail in the help for each command.

# snyk authopen in new window

Authenticate Snyk CLI with a Snyk account.

# snyk testopen in new window

Test a project for open source vulnerabilities and license issues.

# snyk monitoropen in new window

Snapshot and continuously monitor a project for open source vulnerabilities and license issues.

# snyk containeropen in new window

Test container images for vulnerabilities.

# snyk iac describeopen in new window

Detect, track, and alert on infrastructure drift and unmanaged resources.

# snyk iac gen-driftignoreopen in new window

Generate driftignore rules to be used by snyk iac test.

# snyk iac testopen in new window

Test for any known security issue.

# snyk codeopen in new window

Find security issues using static code analysis.

# snyk log4shellopen in new window

Find Log4Shell vulnerability.

# snyk configopen in new window

Manage Snyk CLI configuration.

# snyk policyopen in new window

Display the .snyk policy for a package.

# snyk ignoreopen in new window

Modify the .snyk policy to ignore stated issues.

# New CLI commands

# snyk fixopen in new window

Apply the recommended updates for supported ecosystems automatically.

# snyk appsopen in new window

Create a Snyk App using the Snyk CLI.

# Subcommands of CLI commands

The following is a list of the sub-commands for Snyk CLI commands. Each sub-command is followed by the command(s) to which the sub-command applies. The commands are linked to their help docs. For details concerning each sub-command, see the help docs.

test: subcommand of codeopen in new window and containeropen in new window

monitor: subcommand of containeropen in new window

get <KEY>: subcommand of configopen in new window

set <KEY>=<VALUE>: subcommand of configopen in new window

unset <KEY>: subcommand of configopen in new window

clear: subcommand of configopen in new window

# Exit codes

Possible exit codes and their meaning:

0: success, no vulnerabilities found
1: action_needed, vulnerabilities found
2: failure, try to re-run command
3: failure, no supported projects

# Configure the Snyk CLI

You can use environment variables to configure the Snyk CLI and also set variables to configure the Snyk CLI to connect with the Snyk API. See Configure the Snyk CLIopen in new window.

# Debug

Use -d option to output the debug logs.

# Options for multiple commands

Lists of the options for Snyk CLI commands follow. Each option is followed by the command(s) to which the option applies. The commands are linked to their help docs. For details concerning each option, see the help docsopen in new window.

--all-projects: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window

--detection-depth=<DEPTH>: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window, iac testopen in new window

--exclude=<DIRECTORY>[,<DIRECTORY>]...>: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window

--prune-repeated-subdependencies, -p: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window

--print-deps: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window, containeropen in new window

--remote-repo-url=<URL>: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window

--dev: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window

--org=<ORG_ID>: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window, iac testopen in new window, iac describeopen in new window

--file=<FILE>: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window

--package-manager=<PACKAGE_MANAGER_NAME>: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window

--ignore-policy: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window, iac testopen in new window, iac describeopen in new window

--trust-policies testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window

--show-vulnerable-paths=<none|some|all> testopen in new window

--project-name=<PROJECT_NAME>: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window, containeropen in new window

--target-reference=<TARGET_REFERENCE>: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window

--policy-path=<PATH_TO_POLICY_FILE>: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window, containeropen in new window, iac testopen in new window, iac describeopen in new window, ignoreopen in new window

--json: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window, codeopen in new window, containeropen in new window, iac testopen in new window, iac describeopen in new window

--json-file-output=<OUTPUT_FILE_PATH>: testopen in new window, containeropen in new window, iac testopen in new window, iac describeopen in new window

--sarif: testopen in new window, containeropen in new window, iac testopen in new window

--sarif-file-output=<OUTPUT_FILE_PATH>: testopen in new window, containeropen in new window, iac testopen in new window

--severity-threshold=<low|medium|high|critical>: testopen in new window, codeopen in new window, containeropen in new window, iac testopen in new window

--fail-on=<all|upgradable|patchable>: testopen in new window

--project-environment=<ENVIRONMENT>[,<ENVIRONMENT>]...>: monitoropen in new window, containeropen in new window

--project-lifecycle=<LIFECYCLE>[,<LIFECYCLE>]...>: monitoropen in new window, containeropen in new window

--project-business-criticality=<BUSINESS_CRITICALITY>[,<BUSINESS_CRITICALITY>]...>: monitoropen in new window, containeropen in new window

--project-tags=<TAG>[,<TAG>]...>: monitoropen in new window, containeropen in new window

--tags=<TAG>[,<TAG>]...>: monitoropen in new window, containeropen in new window

# snyk container command options

--app-vulns: containeropen in new window

--nested-jars-depth: containeropen in new window

--exclude-base-image-vulns: containeropen in new window

--platform=<PLATFORM>: containeropen in new window

--username=<CONTAINER_REGISTRY_USERNAME>: containeropen in new window

--password=<CONTAINER_REGISTRY_PASSWORD>: containeropen in new window

# snyk iac test command options

--scan=<TERRAFORM_PLAN_SCAN_MODE>: iac testopen in new window

--rules=<PATH_TO_CUSTOM_RULES_BUNDLE>: iac testopen in new window

# snyk iac describe command options

--from=<STATE>[,<STATE>...]: iac describeopen in new window

--to=<PROVIDER+TYPE>: iac describeopen in new window

--service=<SERVICE>[,<SERVICE]...>: iac describeopen in new window

--all: iac describeopen in new window

--only-managed: iac describeopen in new window

--only-unmanaged: iac describeopen in new window

--quiet: iac describeopen in new window

--filter: iac describeopen in new window

--html: iac describeopen in new window

--fetch-tfstate-headers: iac describeopen in new window

--tfc-token: iac describeopen in new window

--tfc-endpoint: iac describeopen in new window

--tf-provider-version: iac describeopen in new window

--strict: iac describeopen in new window

--deep: iac describeopen in new window

--driftignore: iac describeopen in new window

--tf-lockfile: iac describeopen in new window

--config-dir: iac describeopen in new window

# snyk iac gen-driftignore command options

--input: iac gen-driftignoreopen in new window

--output=<OUTPUT_FILE_PATH>: iac gen-driftignoreopen in new window

--exclude-changed: iac gen-driftignoreopen in new window

--exclude-missing: iac gen-driftignoreopen in new window

--exclude-unmanaged: iac gen-driftignoreopen in new window

# snyk ignore command options

--id=<ISSUE_ID>: ignoreopen in new window

--expiry=<EXPIRY>: ignoreopen in new window

--reason=<REASON>: ignoreopen in new window

--path=<PATH_TO_RESOURCE>: ignoreopen in new window

# Debug

-d: allopen in new window

# Options for Maven projects

--scan-all-unmanaged: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window

--reachable: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window

--reachable-timeout=<TIMEOUT>: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window

# Options for Gradle projects

--sub-project=<NAME>, --gradle-sub-project=<NAME>: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window

--all-sub-projects: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window

--configuration-matching=<CONFIGURATION_REGEX>: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window

--configuration-attributes=<ATTRIBUTE>[,<ATTRIBUTE>]...: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window

--reachable: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window

--reachable-timeout=<TIMEOUT>: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window

--init-script=<FILE: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window

# Options for .Net and NuGet projects

--assets-project-name: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window

--packages-folder: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window`

--project-name-prefix=<PREFIX_STRING>: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window

--project-name-prefix=my-group/: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window

# Options for npm projects

--strict-out-of-sync=true|false: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window

# Options for Yarn projects

--strict-out-of-sync=true|false: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window

--yarn-workspaces: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window

# Options for CocoaPods projects

--strict-out-of-sync=true|false: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window

# Options for Python projects

--command=<COMMAND>: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window

--skip-unresolved=true|false: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window

# Options for Go projects

Currently the following options are not supported:

--fail-on=<all|upgradable|patchable>: testopen in new window

# Option for C/C++ projects

--unmanaged: testopen in new window, monitoropen in new window

For information about this option see Snyk CLI for C / C++ projectsopen in new window.

# -- [<CONTEXT-SPECIFIC_OPTIONS>]

These options are used with the snyk test and snyk monitor commands. See the help docs for snyk testopen in new window and snyk monitoropen in new window for details.
